incongruent_moments.reason: The speaker's verbal content, stating "Just say anything," reflects a dismissive attitude, yet the face shows a significantly positive valence (0.632) while the audio conveys a negative valence (-0.125), indicating a divergence between text and face as well as text and audio modalities. This incongruence suggests a potential masking of true feelings or uncertainty despite a seemingly confident facial expression. [t: 2.1–16.8 s; text_v: -0.059; face_v: 0.632; audio_v: -0.125]

The speaker's verbal content, stating "I have a million dollars," suggests a positive self-image; however, the non-verbal signals reveal a stark contrast, with a mean face valence of -0.0498 and audio valence of -0.1250 indicating negative emotional states. This divergence between the text's positive assertion and the face/audio's negative metrics suggests a lack of genuine confidence or possible sarcasm in the claim. [t: 19.1–28.0 s; text_v: 0.0596; face_v: -0.0498; audio_v: -0.1250].

transcript_text: Um, my name is, wait, can I give you lies too? Just say anything. Alright, my name is Rob Wazowski, um, I'm 21 years old, uh, I was born in 2010, um, I drive a red car, um, and uh, I have a million dollars in my bank account right now.
